content: Today, I sorted through my travel thoughts at a café. This trip took me to several ancient towns, leaving me with mixed feelings. title: Discharge Instructions for Father
content:
**Meeting Minutes with Director Wang - 2025-11-18 10:15**

Key Points:
1.  Recovery is progressing well. The wound is healing normally, and the patient can gradually begin getting out of bed for light activity.
2.  Medication: After discharge, it is essential to take the antihypertensive medication (Norvasc, once daily, one tablet) on time. A new anticoagulant medication (Xarelto) has been added; the specific dosage must be followed as prescribed by the doctor.
3.  Rehabilitation Restrictions: Avoid strenuous exercise and heavy lifting for three months. Maintain a bland, low-salt diet.
4.  Follow-up Appointment: Schedule an outpatient review in two weeks. A reminder has been given to set this in the calendar.
5.  Emergency Contact: Director Wang's office telephone number.
summarized_info: At the doctor's office, Feng Haoran used a note-taking app to meticulously record the key medical instructions from Director Wang regarding his father's post-discharge recovery, medication, contraindications, and follow-up appointment arrangements.

title: Questions to ask Director Wang tomorrow
content:
1. What is the current target blood pressure value for my father? How many times a day should it be measured after discharge?  
2. Should the newly added anticoagulant medication (Xarelto) be taken before or after meals? Is regular monitoring of coagulation function required? If so, how often?  
3. Apart from avoiding strenuous exercise, what are the recommendations for the intensity and duration of daily walks and stair climbing?  
4. In terms of diet, besides a low-salt intake, are there any specific considerations for protein and fat consumption? For example, can he consume chicken soup or eat eggs?

It has been identified as the preferred option. A "Comparison Table of Preferred Family Medical Insurance Plans" has been prepared for discussion with my father tomorrow.

title: Minutes of Video Communication with Parents Regarding Insurance Plan
content: On December 9th, I had a video call with my parents to finalize the insurance plan. I once again explained in detail the differences and complementary nature of the two types of insurance: medical insurance is primarily used to reimburse hospitalization expenses, while critical illness insurance provides a lump-sum payment upon diagnosis to compensate for income loss and cover rehabilitation costs. The finalized combination plan is: medical insurance + critical illness insurance. I asked my parents to prepare their ID cards, household registration booklet, and my father’s medical records, and to carefully fill out the subsequent health declaration questionnaire.
summarized_info: Feng Haoran documented the key points from the video discussion with his parents regarding the insurance plan. It was confirmed that the finalized insurance types are medical insurance and critical illness insurance, and the required materials were listed.

title: Flight Thoughts: Key Annotations on the DeFi and NFT Report
content:
Reading the "In-depth Analysis Report on DeFi and NFT Markets in Q1" Annotations:
1. DeFi Section: Focused on the deposit and lending rate models of mainstream protocols such as Aave and Compound, considering their sustainability. The report points out that over-reliance on governance token incentives is a flaw in the economic model.
2. NFT Section: The report analyzes the floor price fluctuations of leading PFP projects and the risk of liquidity depletion. Annotation: The valuation of NFTs as collateral lacks on-chain oracle support, which is the core challenge for liquidity.
3. Personal Insight: It is necessary to integrate the overall framework of Web3.0 to understand the interrelationships between the underlying technology (consensus mechanisms), upper-layer applications (DeFi/NFT), and market policies.
summarized_info: I have documented the key reading annotations on the "Q1 In-depth Analysis Report on DeFi and NFT Markets," covering the economic models of DeFi protocols and the analysis of liquidity risks in the NFT market.

title: Summary of Digital Asset Learning in May
content: Reviewing the learning framework for digital assets in early to mid-May: 1. Technical Foundation: Revisited blockchain consensus mechanisms such as Bitcoin's Proof of Work (PoW) and Ethereum's Proof of Stake (PoS), which serve as the fundamental basis. 2. Application Layer Analysis: Conducted an in-depth study of various DeFi (Decentralized Finance) protocols, particularly their economic models and risk-return profiles, as well as valuation and liquidity issues in the NFT (Non-Fungible Token) market. 3. Market and Policy: Tracked the evolution of cryptocurrency regulatory policies in major economies and analyzed their impact on market structure and investor behavior. These three directions constitute the current research framework.
summarized_info: I have summarized the learning on digital assets during the first and middle ten days of May, covering three areas: blockchain technology, DeFi and NFTs, as well as market and regulatory policies.

title: Reflections on Household Financial Risk

During a break from accompanying him at the hospital today, I began systematically researching personal pension policies. This is not only a precautionary measure but also a wake-up call from this incident—I must establish a more solid financial plan for my parents' long-term health and my own retirement. The next steps require focused research on: 1. Comparing supplementary commercial health insurance products (critical illness/medical); 2. Strategies for opening and configuring personal pension accounts.

The financial gaps exposed by medical risks must be addressed with a more comprehensive protection system.

title: Preparation for Father's Medical Consultation Due to Dizziness
content:

I. Common Causes: Dizziness in the elderly may be related to blood pressure, cervical spine issues, neurological conditions, or benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV), and requires specialized examination.

II. Wuhan Hospital Information: Focus was placed on the health examination packages offered by the Health Management Center of Wuhan Union Hospital. Among them, the 'Premium Comprehensive Elderly Health Examination Package (Enhanced Neurology Edition)' is relatively comprehensive and suitable for father's condition.

III. Action Items: 1. Call Wuhan Union Hospital during tomorrow's lunch break to schedule this package. 2. Organize pre-examination precautions (such as fasting, temporary suspension of certain medications, etc.). 3. Share the information in the family group chat and remind parents and younger sister.

title: Notes from a Visit to the Stamp Museum
content: On November 23, 2025, I visited the China Postage Stamp Museum for the second time. This time, I was able to view the exhibits more leisurely, following the historical timeline. I lingered for a long time in front of display cases featuring rare items such as the "Large Dragon Stamps," carefully reading the descriptions and taking photographs. I also purchased a 2024 commemorative envelope and a stamp catalog. Being alone allowed me to make up for the regret of rushing through my previous visit. The museum building itself is quite distinctive, with its Republican-era architectural style. Sunlight streamed through the windows into the exhibition hall, creating a pleasant atmosphere.
summarized_info: In his notes, Feng Haoran documented the experience and reflections from his second solo visit to the China Postage Stamp Museum on November 23, 2025.
